title: Savoury pancakes with a mildly spiced chutney
directions: Mix the tomatoes, onions, chillies, salt, chilli powder and cinnamon powder into the semolina mixture. Pour this batter (just like you would with pancakes) onto a KitchenAid Saucepan on low heat and spread to flatten (if necessary).
Cook on each side for four-five minutes until golden and slightly crisp. Remove and repeat with the remaining batter. Garnish with coriander leaves.

Heat half a tablespoon of oil in a pan and sauté the chana dal, onions, tomatoes and green chillies until golden brown. Cool for a few minutes before adding this mixture along with the chopped coconut and salt to a KitchenAid Diamond Blender. Blend until smooth and transfer to a bowl.
Fry the mustard seeds in the remaining tablespoon of oil until they pop. Remove from heat, pour onto the chutney and give it a good stir. Serve along with the cheela.
ingredients: 300 grams semolina, soaked in 4 cups of water for at least 2 hours
